@_jrivero_ It looks like `CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR` is defined by `/usr/share/cmake-[version]/Modules/GNUInstallDirs.cmake`.  This puts installed libraries under `[CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX]/lib/[CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR]/`, and we need to modify `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` and `LIBRARY_PATH` to make things work correctly.  Is that correct?

If I force `CMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR` to be `lib`, then cmake config file exports variable: `GAZEBO_libRARY_DIRS`, which appears to breaks other packages that depends on gazebo given other packages look for `GAZEBO_LIBRARY_DIRS` without the lower case `lib`.
